intro: Mezoneuron peekelii, commonly known as the Peckel's mezoneuron, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude regions. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
